title: Curried Lime Chicken
description: The chicken breasts in this recipe are sliced in two and pan-fried in curry spices, meaning they take less time to cook. The rice and sweet potato are cooked together in the same pan, allowing you time to whiz up your fresh coriander and lime chutney, which is zingy and salsa-like.

cooking_instructions.instruction: Add the rice, 375ml (750ml) of water and salt (optional) to a pot with a lid on a high heat and bring to the boil

Peel the sweet potatoes and chop into 5cm pieces

Once the water in the rice pot is boiling, add the sweet potatoes and put a lid on

Reduce the heat to medium and cook for 10 min, or until the potatoes are softened and rice cooked
Slice each chicken breast in half lengthwise, to form 4 (8) escalopes

Reserve 1 tsp (2 tsp) of curry powder (used in step 7)

Coat the chicken with the remaining curry powder

Season to your taste with salt and pepper

Add 2-4 tbsp of olive oil to a large pan

Once the oil is hot, add the chicken

Cook on each side for 4 min or until cooked through

Chop the coriander coarsely (including the stalks)

Grate the zest of the lime(s)

Add the coriander, lime zest, juice of the lime(s), 3 tbsp (6 tbsp) of olive oil, the remaining curry powder, and a pinch of each salt and sugar in a processor or blender

Combine until you get a green fresh tasting chutney/salsa

Tip: Pour any remaining pan juices from the chicken into the dressing

Plate up the rice and sweet potato with the chicken

Spoon the coriander and lime dressing over the plates

Enjoy!
